title: Oil edges lower on US demand concerns ahead of Fed interest-rate decision

summary: The US is weighing the creation of a $5 billion mining investment fund, which would mark its largest step yet into direct dealmaking to secure critical minerals, according to a Bloomberg report out this morning. As a result, shares of rare earth companies MP Materials and USAR are both surging high…

title: Japan's JERA Looks to Seal $1.7 Billion U.S. Shale Gas Deal
summary: Japanese energy firm JERA is in advanced discussions to buy shale gas assets in the United States worth about $1.7 billion, sources with knowledge of the talks have told Reuters. If a deal is finalized, this would be a major investment from Japan in the U.S. energy industry, per the U.S.-Japan trad…

title: US Crude Oil Inventories Plummet, Pushing Prices Higher
summary: Crude oil inventories in the United States decreased by 9.3 million barrels during the week ending September 12, after adding 3.9 million barrels in the week prior, according to new data from the U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) released on Wednesday. The draw is one of the largest week…

title: Top Oil Traders Vie to Buy Chevron’s 50% in Singapore Refinery
summary: Commodity trading giants Vitol and Glencore are set to formally bid to buy Chevron’s 50% stake in a major refinery in Singapore, Reuters reported on Wednesday, citing several sources with knowledge of the plans. As Chevron is looking to cut costs and reshuffle priorities in the downstream business,…

title: Egypt’s Oil and Gas Output Rebounds After Four-Year Decline
summary: After four years of declines, Egypt’s oil and gas production has started to rise in recent weeks, providing much-needed relief to the import bill of the North African country. title: Chinese Teapots Start Buying Crude for Two Refineries
summary: Two independent Chinese refiners have started buying feedstock for two bankrupt refineries that they acquired from a state-owned company, Reuters has reported, citing trade sources without naming them. title: ETFs are overwhelmingly a young man’s game, study finds
summary: Almost a third of UK investors aged over 55 have never heard of exchange traded funds

title: Old School RuneScape says no more Mr Nice Guy, it's time for permabans and confiscations if you're caught buying black market gold
summary: But some players will believe it when they see it.
body: Old School RuneScape (OSRS) has a cancer, and that cancer is crime. Or, well, it's repeated violations of Jagex's terms of service, anyway. The game is beset by perfidious players who buy in-game gold and items off black market sellers using real-world money, a process called Real World Trading (RWT). Okay, yes, some version of that happens in a lot of MMOs, but it's a particular thorn in the side for Jagex and its players, leading as it does to legions of bots infesting the game in order to vacuum up gold to sell later on. Now, Jagex has decided it's no more Mr Nice Guy time: the punishments for buying gold are getting harsher. "Buying gold off a real world trader is already very clearly against the rules, but historically we've treated the buyers more leniently than the sellers when issuing penalties for real world trading," said Jagex in a post earlier today . But no longer: "As part of our clamp-down on those gold-farming bots and the harm they do to Old School RuneScape, we're now taking a harsher line against players caught buying gold from them." In other words, don't expect to get away with a slap on the wrist just because you were only buying gold or an in-game item from …

title: Blame game erupts over Qatar plot as Banque Havilland challenges UK watchdog
summary: FCA accused David ‘Spotty’ Rowland’s bank and employees of scheme to devalue Qatari currency
